title: Architectural; Draftsperson
compensation: Compensation based upon experience and abilities
description:
Studio AR&D Architects is seeking an entry to mid-level Architectural Draftsperson to work collaboratively with our design and technical team on a variety of project types. The ideal candidate will be dynamic team-player with a background in architecture, and the production of design development and construction documents. Candidates must possess a strong work ethic and be organized, detail-oriented, punctual, and professional. Reliable transportation, travel to and from job sites upon request is also a requirement.

Projects vary in size and complexity and will generally focus on high-end, custom residential and hospitality and shall require an individual with the ability to work effectively and efficiently. Work tasks will include taking a project design development through completion. The position requires hands on experience through periodic site visits and potential for individual growth. Knowledge of construction documents, construction details in wood, masonry, concrete, steel, glazing, and various other materials are just a few of the many facets to this position as we provide innovative designs and work with the changing demands that this profession requires.


Job Responsibilities & Interests include but are not limited to: 

-Capable of multi-tasking 
-Primary focus on CAD drafting of plans 
-Updating plans due to evolving design revisions 
-Producing plans and project documents for submittals 
-Maintaining electronic libraries 
-Working with the office Design Manager and existing team on all aspects of project development and follow-through  
-Developing cad drawings beginning with detail sketches and layouts based upon instructions from the Principal & Project Managers. 
-Collaborating with contractors, subcontractors and consultants both in the office and on site 
-Attending meetings and interaction with consultants, contractors, email, phone calls and through in person meetings and presentations. 
-Researching and sourcing materials, vendors, pricing, and product specifications
-Various other office duties including strong organizational skills and duties, creating office standards, project site meetings, etc.
-Creative thinking and problem solving
-Strong Interest in contemporary architecture (portfolio, prior work examples, and resume must reflect this passion)
-Experience with the submission of construction documents at various local governmental agencies and offices


Position Requirements: 

-Ability to multi-task while maintaining a high level of detail and accuracy.  
-5-8 years experience at an architectural office 
-Highly proficient in AutoCAD including paper space, Xref, plotting, etc. (Must be presently using 2012 or newer version) 
-Highly proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
-Experience generating schedules, MEP's, and elevations 
-Ability to read and scale architectural drawings 
-Proficient Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe  - Effective Communication skills.
-Knowledge and skill using BIM would be a bonus but not required (1. Archicad or 2. Revit) 
-Being a self-starter who can take initiative & ownership of duties given while also working well as part of a team is mandatory


This is a full-time position, available immediately, within the office (no tele-commuting or working remotely).

 
To apply for this position include the following: 

COVER LETTER 
RESUME 
PDF SAMPLES OF DESIGN WORK OR RELATED MATERIALS, SOME OF WHICH MUST HAVE BEEN  PRODUCED WITH A CAD PROGRAM
Send all of the above in an email format via craigslist "reply"

Notes: 

-All materials should be formatted for easy printing in PDF format
-Keep attachments under 3MB 
-Please include all of the above and send via email. 

Please respond with cover letter, resume, portfolio and references. Please, no phone calls or third parties. Please do not send links to websites or online resumes, photos or video presentations. Competitive salary based on relevant experience and abilities. We offer a full comprehensive medical benefits package including earned paid sick, vacation time, and paid holidays. Special incentives for ARE exam takers are also available. Thank you!

title: Engineering-Civil 1-5 Yrs. Exp. (Special Projects)
description:
KPFF’s Special Projects Division, currently is seeking a full-time Civil Engineer in its Long Beach, CA office for interested and qualified candidates. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.

Position Requirements:
Minimum of 1 year of civil design experience
EIT is preferred
Computer proficiency is required, including Microsoft Office Programs
Computer Aided Drafting experience is desired (Autocad /Civil 3D &/or Microstation)
Ability and desire to work in team environment
Willingness to work on variety of projects
Ability to work dynamically and effectively with clients and project team members
 

KPFF's Special Projects Division, located near the heart of downtown Long Beach, CA, and is a part of a dynamic 80+ person group that provides planning, civil, structural, and mechanical engineering, machinery design, construction management, and project management. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development. Our work generally leans toward heavy civil and industrial infrastructure throughout the US West Coast, and requires us to solve unusual challenges frequently with non-codified solutions.

Typical project types include:
Design/Build
Transportation Infrastructure
Commercial Developments
Ports
Industrial Developments
Shipyards
Cruise Terminals
Small Boat Harbors
Marinas

We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.  Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company.  Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.

We focus on the long term:  Build lasting relationships, maintain an excellent reputation, help improve our profession, help our clients to succeed, and provide increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.

We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of some projects, which require unique management and technical skills.  The KPFF Special Projects Division was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively. 

While each member of KPFF Special Projects Division brings strong technical abilities to the team, a special strength lies in their ability to communicate clearly; to hear what clients are saying; and to derive and implement solutions that achieve clients’ goals.  Their energy, commitment, and “ownership” of issues and projects ensure project success.

KPFF Consulting Engineers is an engineering firm with over 1200 employees nationwide, headquartered in Seattle, Washington. We offer:

Competitive Benefits
Competitive salaries
Performance based bonuses
Flexible working hours
Great work environment

If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest through the attached link. 


Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.

KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law

title: Electrical Graduate Engineer/Designer
description:
Encotech Engineering Consultants is experiencing an exciting time of growth and change.  With the expansion of our services and markets, we have a need to increase our team to accommodate our new opportunities.  We are currently seeking an electrical graduate engineer for our mechanical / electrical / plumbing (MEP) Department.   We are looking for polished, energetic, flexible outgoing professionals with a “Can Do” attitude. 

Founded in 1990, our firm provides mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and structural engineering and design services.  Our MEP Department provides complete and detailed mechanical heating, ventilation, air conditioning, plumbing and electrical engineering and design services for commercial, industrial, governmental and institutional buildings/projects.  

Position:
Graduate electrical engineering / design position with a MEP consulting engineering firm.

Required Education and Certificates: 
•	Bachelor Degree in Architectural Engineering or
•	Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering 

Required Experience: 
•	At least 3 years of electrical engineering, design and CAD/Revit drafting experience.

Position Description, Minimum Duties and Expectations: 
•	Reports directly to the Project Manager and under the guidance of a professional engineer. 
•	Preparing incoming AutoCAD and Revit files from client for mechanical, electrical and plumbing construction document production.
•	Creating electrical drawing cover sheets, detail sheets, one-line diagrams, schedule sheets, specification sheets and other typical project specific construction documents. 
•	Perform electrical power and lighting analysis, engineering, design, and production of AutoCAD and Revit construction drawing under the direction of a professional engineer and graduate engineers.
•	Maintain electrical drawings, details, and schedule databases.
•	Organize and maintain project documentation from start to completion.
•	Review of electrical submittals.
•	Respond to electrical field related issues, conflicts, and RFI’s during the construction phase.
•	Communicate & Coordinate effectively and professionally with project managers and internal staff. 

Required Qualifications: 
•	Proficient with AutoCAD and Revit.
•	Ability to read and interpret construction, shop, and design drawings.
•	Proficient in All Microsoft Office Applications 
•	Team Player with Positive Attitude
•	Polished/Professional Demeanor 
•	Strong Organizational Skills 
•	Multi-task oriented 
•	Works well under pressure 
•	Works well as a team member, providing support and coordination with team
•	Excellent Communication Skills

Benefits Offered:
•	Medical & Dental Insurance 
•	Short Term & Long Term Disability 
•	Continuing Education 
•	401(k) 
•	Profit Sharing 
•	PTO 
•	Paid Holidays 

TO APPLY: 
1.	Please email your resume detailing prior positions held with months/years of employment.
2.	Attach a cover letter explaining why you feel this position is a good fit for you. 
3.	Submit answers to the following: 
•	Salary history from your last two positions 
•	Reason for leaving last two positions

title: Architectural Drafter
description:
Our family owned design and architectural consulting firm is growing and plans to expand our team of drafters & designers. We’ve been in business for almost 30 years and have significant experience designing architectural plans for residential homes and small businesses throughout Southern California. Working alongside a team of engineers and project coordinators, the newly hired drafter would contribute to the submittal and plan check process for a constantly evolving portfolio of clients.

We’re looking for a mid-level drafter that can join our team and hit the ground running. The ideal candidate should have drafting experience, some familiarity with building and safety codes, municipal plan check process and residential construction. Typically, new drafters should be able to create floor plans, site plans, elevations, roof plans, construction plans, etc. 

Our team is small and nimble, so we really need a self-starter that can problem solve and work independently. We are looking to hire on a part-time basis (approximately 15-25 hours/week), however, would consider expanding the role if we found the right candidate. 

Desired Qualifications:
•	3-5 years of experience drafting architectural plans for California based clients
•	Advanced proficiency in AutoCAD (or similar drafting software)
•	Ability to create complete sets of architectural plans for submittal with minimal corrections
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
•	Detail oriented and willing to respond to changing priorities 
•	Independent yet collaborative nature

Interested applicants should submit a resume and 3-5 PDF samples of their work via email. Before being selected for an in-person interview, select candidates will undergo a brief phone screen with one of our project coordinators. 

Hourly wage starting at $17-$20 depending on experience.

title: Construction Documentation Photographer
description:
Construction Photographer   
I.	Position Available:
Multivista is seeking a Construction Photographer for its Los Angeles, CA office. For your consideration to this position, please submit a resume in .doc or .docx format. (.pdf is also acceptable) Those who submit without are not considered and filtered out by our computer system.

As a Construction photographer with Multivista, your duties may include:
•	Performing photographic documentation on commercial and residential construction sites
•	Accessing buildings and sites in all stages of construction to perform the tasks of gathering photos of specific milestones and procedures
•	Coordinating with third-party project personnel
•	Managing project schedules
•	Organizing construction drawings or CAD files for cost estimates and to create interfaces under the direction of your Operations Manager
•	Position has the potential to develop into territory Operations Manager
•	Position is part-time, with high probability of developing into full-time
•	At times, the photographer can also perform the following duties: Matterport scans, 3D laser point-cloud gathering, video recording and UAV/Drone flights as directed
II.	Desired Work History or Experience:
•	 Photography experience preferable, but not necessary 
•	 Knowledge of construction terminology or having completed some or all of college in ANY field
•	 Ability to read and discern blueprints and construction drawings 
•	 Exceptional organizational and time management skills 
•	 Career-oriented team player
•	 Computer proficient 
•	 Ability to work alone 
•	 Must have own reliable vehicle, travel by car will cover areas from San Diego county, up to Santa Barbara
III.	Compensation:
•	 Compensation is $17 - $23 per hour, commensurate with experience  
IV.	Requirements:
 Education:  
 High School or equivalent required, College experience is preferred
 Experience:
•	 Experience within the construction industry or within architectural or outdoor photography
•	 On-site construction experience highly preferred
•	 Computer proficiency; Excel, Outlook and Word, highly preferred
•	 Clean driving record and reliable transportation for site visits
•	 Phone with ability to run updated apps and carry drawings as .pdfs
•	 Ability to read and discern blueprints, construction drawings and other construction documents
•	 Demonstrable ability to autonomously manage schedule
•	 OSHA certification preferred
•	 Exceptional organizational and time-management skills

 ***NOTE:  POSITIONS ARE IMMEDIATELY AVAILABLE WITH ANTICIPATED START DATE OF 9/1/2019, FOR TRAINING.  INTERVIEWS WILL BE HELD BEGINNING ON August 14, 2019 IN Marina Del Rey.  BRIEF PHONE INTERVIEWS MAY BE CONDUCTED BEFORE OR IN LIEU OF IN-PERSON INTERVIEWS***
V.	Company Overview:
Multivista is the leading provider of visual documentation to the Construction and Facilities Management Industries. Multivista combines photography, video and webcam services with a robust software delivery platform to create interactive records of actual construction conditions and events. 
Founded in 2003, Multivista now operates in almost every major metropolitan area across the United States and Canada, and in the United Kingdom. Multivista has been awarded contracts to document more than 1.5 billion square feet of construction projects, across nearly every vertical market, in the last five years alone.
Visit www.multivista.com for more information about Multivista.
Please do not contact the corporate office regarding this posting.

title: Senior Project Environmental Geologist
compensation: Excellent salary and benefits commensurate with experience.
description:
Job Description: Ninyo & Moore has an immediate opening for a Senior Project Environmental Geologist in Irvine or Monterey Park, CA. The successful candidate will prepare and manage Phase I and Phase II Environmental Site Assessments, Initial Site Assessments (Caltrans), Hazardous Materials Assessments (CEQA/NEPA), Preliminary Endangerment Assessments (PEAs), Conceptual site models, and Risk Assessments. Responsibilities will include meeting and interacting with the clients and regulatory agencies, managing project budgets and schedules and performing some business development activities with select clients. The candidate will also coordinate and participate in field activities, including drilling supervision, logging of borings, test pits, trenches and cores; evaluating geologic and hydrogeologic conditions; and sampling soil, soil gas, and groundwater; and will prepare environmental proposals and reports.

Education: B.S./M.S. in Geology.

The ideal candidate will bring local experience and familiarity with the local geologic practice and a strong knowledge of local, state and federal regulations. title: Maintenance Tech III at Montage Hotel
description:
At Montage International, we are doing something different, something exciting and it takes passionate people to bring our vision to life. We have built a culture that leads with the important notion we live by every day; do what you love. If this resonates with you, we look forward to receiving your application. 





The Engineering Maintenance Technician III will be responsible for maintaining all buildings and equipment throughout the hotel. This role will contribute to the organization as an active business partner that is responsible for supporting the company's goals, objectives, vision, mission, and values.




Job duties include; although are not limited to:

Troubleshoot equipment using proper tools in a skilled craftsman-like manner.
Perform assignments as directed by the Director of Engineer.
Assume the duties of other mechanics when required, including light carpentry, plumbing, grounds maintenance, electrical, painting, pool and spa maintenance, etc.
Perform preventative maintenance on all equipment.
Repair all malfunctioning mechanic devices.
Perform electrical, air conditioning, heating, plumbing, boiler, and television repair needs.
Participate in services to ducts and grease traps.
Rekeys lock and maintains the key system.
Train other maintenance staff on equipment, systems, and procedures.
Assume responsibility when the Engineering Manager or Director of Engineering is not available.



High school or equivalent education required.  
Minimum of three years' job related maintenance experience or engineering.
Minimum of two years' experience in customer service.
Ability to communicate clearly and speak, read, write and understand English.



Luxury hotel experience strongly preferred.
Certification from Technical Maintenance Trade School.
Bachelor's Degree.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and various property specific software applications, HotSOS, and Energy Management Systems software.



Position requires walking and giving direction most of the working day; must be able to stand and exert well-paced mobility for up to 6 hours in length. Must be able to exert well-paced ability to maneuver between functions occurring simultaneously. Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. on a regular and continuing basis. Must be able to push and pull carts and equipment weighing up to 250 lbs. occasionally. Must be able to walk, stand, sit, bend, stoop, squat and stretch to fulfill tasks. Must have finger dexterity to be able to operate office equipment. 

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

title: Floor Plan Measurer: AS-BUILT Drawings $40-$50/hr (Los Angeles)
compensation: $40-$50 per hour plus $10 travel and $10 per diem
description:
We have an immediate opening for a floor plan measurer. This is a flexible position for part-time work (contractor). You will set your own schedule and we will fit appointments into your availability (M-F, 9-5 only). 

Applicant must be highly experienced in creating as-built condition drawings (floor plans) of residential and commercial properties in CAD. Applicant must have the ability to create CAD drawings on-site using own laptop and AutoCAD software. Taking measurements on paper and later transferring to CAD drawings is NOT acceptable. Applicant must use a laser tape measure on-site.

Applicant must:
- Have a good understanding of building construction
- Be highly-proficient in CAD
- Have availability during normal weekday business hours: 9-5 to survey properties (please do not apply if you are looking for after-hour or weekend appointments.)
- Have own vehicle to visit properties
- Be reliable and very detail oriented

There are no set number of measurements in a day or week as appointments vary from week to week. We prefer a candidate with lots of availability but can set up as many or as few appointments as desired. This is a great, flexible opportunity for the right candidate.

Compensation: $40-$50 per hr plus $10 travel and $10 per diem

Please send email with your previous work experience and education. 
You must use the following subject line in your email: "Re: Floor Plan Measurer - Los Angeles"

title: Engineering-Civil 3-5 Yrs. Exp. (Special Projects - Long Beach)
description:
KPFF's Special Projects Division, currently is seeking a full-time Civil Engineer in its Long Beach, CA office for interested and qualified candidates. We are looking for self-motivated people who are eager to develop design and project management skills and who are passionate about providing exceptional client service.

Position Requirements:

        •	Minimum of 3 years of civil design experience
        •	Design experience related to civil infrastructure on waterfront, commercial, and industrial sites and/or 
                major transportation infrastructure desirable.
        •	PE License Preferred
        •	BS in Civil Engineering
        •	Working knowledge of Southern California Storm Water Design Criteria
        •	Ability and desire to fulfill duties as discipline design lead
        •	Ability and desire to work in team environment
        •	Willingness to work on variety of projects
        •	Microstation, AutoCAD ,and Civil 3D proficiency is desired
        •	Ability to work dynamically with clients and project team members

KPFF's Special Projects Division, located near the heart of Long Beach, CA, and is a part of a dynamic 70+ person group that provides planning, civil, structural, and mechanical engineering, machinery design and project management. We provide these services on a wide range of project types through all stages of development. Our work generally leans toward heavy civil and industrial infrastructure throughout the US West Coast, and requires us to solve unusual challenges frequently with non-codified solutions.

Typical project types include:

         •	Design/Build 
         •	Transportation Infrastructure
         •	Commercial Developments
         •	Ports
         •	Industrial Developments
         •	Shipyards
         •	Cruise Terminals
         •	Small Boat Harbors
         •	Marinas

We are an engineering-focused company that is organized around the precept that great people thrive in an environment that enables freedom and independence while also providing the necessary amount of accountability and support.  Trust and excellence are foundational values for our company.  Our non-bureaucratic approach depends on trustworthy people who are dedicated to excellence in everything they do.
We focus on the long term:  Build lasting relationships, maintain an excellent reputation, help improve our profession, help our clients to succeed, and provide increasing opportunities for the great people that make up KPFF.

We have recognized that there are specialized issues associated with development of some projects, which require unique management and technical skills.  The KPFF Special Projects Division was established to directly address these concerns with a unique combination of focused dedication to successful delivery via specialized project managers, a highly qualified technical staff, and a predisposition to think and act innovatively.  

While each member of KPFF Special Projects Division brings strong technical abilities to the team, a special strength lies in their ability to communicate clearly; to hear what clients are saying; and to derive and implement solutions that achieve clients' goals.  Their energy, commitment, and "ownership" of issues and projects ensure project success.

KPFF Consulting Engineers is an engineering firm with over 1000 employees nationwide, headquartered in Seattle, Washington. 

We offer:

         •	Competitive Benefits
         •	Competitive salaries
         •	Performance based bonuses
         •	Flexible working hours
         •	Great work environment

If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume and a letter of interest through the attached link. 



Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.

KPFF Consulting Engineers is committed to recruiting and employing qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

Min. Experience - 3 yrs.
Min. Education - Bachelor's Degree
Job Type - Permanent

title: Senior Construction Project Manager
compensation: $90,000 - 100,000 per annum base salary, full health care, performance bonus, flexible working.
description:
Who are we?

Rooftop Cinema Club was founded in London, England in 2011, and since then we've travelled over to the United States and built alternative outdoor film experience venues on rooftops across New York, California, and Texas.  

Why do we do what we do?

We believe that all experiences should be memorable, which is why we are on a mission to transform nights at the movies into cinematic events like no other. Driven by our love of film in alternative settings, our Rooftops promise a handpicked curation of cult classics, and new releases. We stand for Social Cinema because we believe it’s the future. Join our movement.

Who we're looking for!

We’re seeking a Senior Project Manager with at least 5 years’ experience in a similar position to come and join our small team. A sound understanding of commercial/retail/hospitality architectural construction and permitting for indoor-outdoor hybrid spaces will be essential to this role. This is a full time role, in a 9am-6pm weekday office setting when not traveling or working remotely on projects. 
 
Your role will be to manage the end-to-end process of venue pitching and acquisition, to structural planning, permitting, to the management and overseeing of a team of architects, design, and production managers, through construction to completion on budget and within timeline scope. We have 8 concurrent projects spaces for 2020-21 that require a highly developed sense of how to plan and co-ordinate project resources and exceptional attention to detail. 

You must be presentable, smart, energetic, and proactive, and enjoy working in a close-knit team. Your base will be in our office working alongside the entire company and your schedule needs to be flexible and will require up to 40% travel in the year. It will also require some late nights and/or weekends coming close to opening. You must be local to Los Angeles.
 
What can we offer you for joining our small but mighty team?

We promise you a warm and enthusiastic environment with great team members who enjoy communicating and innovating together, plenty of creativity, and genuinely enjoy working with one another to build the best outdoor cinema experience possible.

 Compensation

In addition to your base salary of $90-100,000 per annum we offer performance related bonuses, full healthcare, paid time off, and flexible working initiatives.
 
You will be responsible for:
 
- Conducting Site Planning and Compliance – oversee various site due diligence items leading up to acquisition of site.Client Management - meeting with and working with the city and potential landlords/clients to facilitate the agreement of new sites. You will manage all relationships between our business, the site, and all associated clients/people.
- Permitting/Approvals – ensure timely obtainment of any and all required project permitting and approvals.
- Developing and Reviewing Building Plans - review drawings, specs, and other project Documents – familiarization of all project documents.
- Contract Administration – help ensure all contractual and permitting obligations are realized.
- Project Scheduling – development, implementation, and management.
- Project Coordination – source key team members per project in different locations (permit teams, architects, construction workers, designers, contractor/subcontractors, sub-consultants, vendors, etc.) Once the project is underway, you will visit our sites to monitor progress, oversee contractor activities, and work to eliminate delays and stay on budget.
- Risk Management – anticipate and mitigate risks that arise during project execution phase.
- Budget Development – work with the Real Estate Acquisitions Team to develop capital expenditure budgets for new projects.
- Project Reporting – produce project specific reports in accordance with project demands and milestones.
- Project Cost Control – track all committed, pending, and anticipated cost events while maintaining project budget.
- Cost Event Negotiations – help ensure highest and best value is realized from design and construction professionals.
- Invoice Review and Processing – review monthly pay apps to ensure all costs are fully substantiated and supported.
- Quality Control and Assurance – help to ensure excellence in delivered product by ensuring conformance to project documents, company standards and branding.
 
Our ideal Senior Project Manager will possess:
 
* At least 5 of experience in project management for architectural projects, construction management, or similar
* Drafting and engineering – experience with drafting building plans and blueprints
* Extensive Project Management skills, with excellent high-level planning skills and understanding of best practices
* experience with Architecture software (AutoCAD, ArchiCAD, Revit, SketchUP)
* Proficiency with Project management tools (BQE Core, Asana, Deltek Ajera)
* the attitude of a smart team-player.
* High emotional intelligence with the ability to thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments.

title: Government Construction Contract Project Manager
description:
Government Construction Contract Project Manager 
Job Description
Contractor offers a wide range of services and construction for the US Military at various bases throughout the US. Contractor performs and manages construction projects through effective estimating, scheduling, safety and financial management controls. 
SUMMARY
The Project Manager will provide leadership, oversight, and overall responsibility for the timeliness, completeness, quality, and cost of multiple construction projects, both commercial and federal but primarily federal. Responsibilities will begin during the estimating process and concluded at completion of the project. Multiple projects, with individual projects ranging from less than $2k to $1m with possibility of 10-20 running concurrently.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Includes the following (Other duties may be assigned):
• Provide overall lead support, direction, and management for assigned construction projects. Facilitate the communication and interaction among the project stakeholders, both internal and external to the company.
• May be responsible for project and cost development, including estimating, bid package preparation, bid solicitation, takeoff, cost estimation with RSMeans data, site visits, constructability reviews, scheduling, etc.
• Lead or participate in kick-off meetings, progress meetings, preparatory meetings, etc., and review scopes of work, special requirements, schedules, and budgets.
• Utilize construction management systems and methodologies as defined by the company, the customer (US Navy) and standards of the industry.
• Be ultimately responsible for the timeliness, completeness, quality, and cost of projects from concept through completion.
• Responsible for establishing a positive and effective relationship with key contacts and to ensure at all times, the delivery of quality workmanship and excellence in customer service.
• Manage and ensure Contractors, Subcontractors, Construction Managers, tradesmen, and administrative staff supporting the project are completely fulfilling all aspects of their responsibilities.
• Ensure that all projects under the position’s direction are administered in compliance with all relevant laws and regulations, including those related to insurance, safety, labor relations, EEOC, etc.
• Supervise and manage all contract requirements including, but not limited to, submittals, application for payments, schedules, budgets, notifications, reports, etc.
• Update senior management regularly on the project, financial status, and perceived level of satisfaction.
SUPERVISORY/MANAGEMENT AUTHORITY
Manage multiple projects without having direct supervisory responsibilities.
Job Requirements
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management or a minimum of 5 years work experience in project management or equivalent discipline. Must be able to obtain appropriate security clearance required per contract. 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
• Ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects in various phases.
• Ability to read, analyze, and interpret contract documents, blueprints, specifications, engineering reports, safety rules and regulations, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedural manuals.
• A demonstrated commitment to exceeding expectations in the delivery of safe, quality, cost efficient, and timely service.
• Demonstrated problem solving skills, ability to face challenging situations, view from a variety of different angles; assess strength of options, select and implement the best solutions.
• Ability to think on your feet, making effective decisions on a timely basis, sometimes with limited information.
• Outstanding written, verbal, public speaking, and presentation skills.
• Working knowledge of contract, federal, and municipal law as it relates to construction projects.
• Competency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project), E4Clicks estimating software
• Extend Present a professional stature and image demeanor at all times.
Desired: 
• US Army Corps of Engineers experience, including familiarity with QCS
• CQC Certification
• PMP Certification
• OSHA 10 or 30 Certification
• Experience with LEED projects
• Experience with Primavera P6
• Experience with RS Means
• Experience with JOC/IDIQ/MATOC-type projects
WORK ENVIRONMENT
This position will require physical labor, mental and visual effort and the ability, on rare occasions, to lift 75lbs. Travel will be necessary per contract requirements. 
Please send resume and salary requirements to the craigslist email at the top of the post. All resumes will be received and held in strict confidentiality.

An Engineer is responsible for maintaining the physical functionality and safety of the facility in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability.

Since being founded in 1919, Hilton has been a leader in the hospitality industry. Today, Hilton remains a beacon of innovation, quality, and success. This continued leadership is the result of our Team Members staying true to our Vision, Mission, and Values. Specifically, we look for demonstration of these Values:
•Hospitality - We're passionate about delivering exceptional guest experiences. 
•Integrity - We do the right thing, all the time. 
•Leadership - We're leaders in our industry and in our communities. 
•Teamwork - We're team players in everything we do.

•Quality

title: Cadd Operator
description:
Tectonic Engineering Consultants is currently seeking a full-time Cadd Operator with structural design experience to join our Newport Beach, CA Office! 

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
The essential functions of this position will include working with computer CADD systems creating, modifying, plotting, and releasing detailed layouts, technical drawings, and working drawings for functional use in accordance with CADD standards from existing drawings, sketches, scanned images, and client drawings. Essential functions also include communicating with project managers, engineers, and other CADD staff in order to create and revise drawings in accordance with project specifications. The Cadd Operator may also perform occasional site visits to obtain necessary specifications, including obtaining photographs, field measurements, and sketching, and will also print, copy, and organize CADD drawings as needed, as well as all other duties as required.

 TO VIEW AND APPLY, PLEASE VISIT: 

QUALIFICATIONS 
•2 years of related work experience, including structural design experience; wireless telecommunications experience is a plus;
•Associate’s Degree or CAD certificate in a related field is a plus;
•Proficiency with AutoCAD 2016 or newer and detailing, as well as functional proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and the ability to utilize other software programs as needed;
•Detail oriented, with excellent written and oral communication skills;
•Requires a valid, acceptable driver’s license to perform site visits.
 

COMPETITIVE SALARY & BENEFITS PACKAGE

In addition to providing competitive salaries, Tectonic offers a wide range of benefit options, including:

•Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental, vision and life
•Opportunities for professional growth and advancement

•Company–observed paid holidays
•Short and long-term disability coverage
•Flexible spending accounts for medical expenses and dependent care

We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, and highly encourage resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected class.

Our recently completed public projects include Pacific Palisades Village and the San Vincente Bungalows in West Hollywood.

Some of the key responsibilities may include but are not limited:	

- Act as primary point of contact between designers, clients, consultants and other project team members.

Photoshop, Indesign, general Microsoft Office (Word/Excel).

City submittals and construction documents.

Design knowledge and sensibility.

Knowledge of other CAD/3D programs, (required) Sketch-Up a plus, 3D perspectives, Revit. 
Hand rendering / sketching.

- Only candidates in the Los Angeles area should apply, preferably less than an hour from Santa Monica area.

- Only applicants with proven landscape/architectural/interior/construction or related experience will be contacted.

Salary and benefits are based on experience. The typical salary level for this position is $45,000. Benefits typically included 8 paid holiday, 8 paid PTO days, 3 paid sick days, monthly cell phone stipend, monthly HRA account, 401k contribution after 3 years of continuous employment, and a yearly bonus.  

Necessary skills, experience, and qualities, and abilities to succeed at LETTER FOUR:

  - Construction administration experience (is a plus)

  1. Confirm that you have the experience listed in the position responsibilities.
  2. State your desired salary range.
  3. Are you currently employed? Please advise when you would be available to begin work.
  4. Are you based locally in the Los Angeles area, and available to interview in person?
  5. Share why you believe you would do well in this position.


PLEASE, only apply if you are in the LOS ANGELES area. It is important to us to find someone who is the right fit for our office environment and this can only be done through an in person interview. Please do NOT contact us if you do not meet all of the minimum qualifications. Lauren Adams and Jeremy Baker

We invest in our staff and provide opportunities for professional and personal development. 

19six Architects is seeking a highly motivated Associate Market Sector Leader (AMSL) to assist with furthering the reach of the Community College Market Sector within the Greater Los Angeles area.  

PURPOSE OF POSITION
The Associate Market Sector Leader position will be grounded on promoting new business development and act as an effective liaison for the Community College market.  As the AMSL, you will be working directly under the Community College Market Sector Leader and Principal-In-Charge to strategically develop and execute 19six’s Community College market sector business development plan.

KEY ATTRIBUTES 
• Strategic	            	            • Innovative		            • Inspirational
• Self-Driven	    	                    • Team Leader		            • Clear & Effective Communicator

PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES 
1. Maintains and fosters positive, professional relationship with clients, consultants, public agencies, contractors and industry sources to ensure successful completion of the project and attract future business.
2. Participate in developing and executing the market sector business development plan with the Principal-In-Charge/MSL.
3. Lead business development activities in collaboration with the Principal-In-Charge/MSL including responses to RFPs, RFQs, SOQs, and attending interviews.
4. Participates in the company’s annual strategic planning session.
5. Assign projects and tasks to dedicated market sector staff and shared staff.  
6. Provides monthly updates on status of new business development and outstanding fee proposals to Principal-In-Charge/MSL.
7. Responsible for the development, approval and execution of project management plans for projects within market sector. 
8. Solicit and negotiate consultant’s services and fees.
9. Responsible for development, approval and execution of project contracts. 
10. Responsible for the financial performance within the assigned market sector. 
11. Responsible for ensuring that 19six Architects quality control standards are met on all deliverables (i.e. plans and specifications).
12. Prepare written performance reviews on dedicated market sector staff and selected shared staff.
13. Participate in performance review meetings with dedicated market sector staff and selected shared staff.
14. Participate in multiple industry gatherings. 
15. Present and or lead interoffice presentations and meetings.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED 
1. 10+ years of experience managing higher education projects (preferred Community College). 
2. Demonstrated knowledge of all disciplines.
3. Strategic understanding of local region, market segment and/or disciplines of focus.
4. Demonstrated knowledge of the value and benefit of integrated design.
5. Demonstrated knowledge of the importance and benefit of sustainable design.
6. Strong written and verbal communication skills.
7. Demonstrated ability to communicate and command respect.
8. Demonstrated ability to guide and motivate personnel.
9. Proven managerial ability to perform the responsibilities indicated.
10. Licensed professional in the jurisdiction in which he/she practices.
11. Demonstrated experience in processing public education projects through DSA, CDE, OPSC, DTSC.

We are proud to reside here on California’s Southern Coast and provide our employees with meaningful work while living a great life.

title: Hayden Homes Regional Land Development Manager
description:
Would you like to work for the 2019 #1 Best Company to work for in Washington?

At HAYDEN HOMES our vision is To Be the Best Homebuilder on Earth! Care to join us? We have an opportunity for an experienced Regional Land Development Manager in our Inland Northwest region. This position may be based in either Spokane or the Tri-Cities, Washington area.




	

The Regional Land Development Manager monitors regional land development needs and manages the land use and development process including feasibility, design, entitlements, and construction of residential subdivisions.

Your responsibilities will include:

Feasibility - Conducts due diligence on potential land development opportunities.
Design – Provides input to consultants and reviews subdivision design to ensure efficiency and conformance with company standards.
Entitlements - Facilitates the processes involved to obtain land entitlements from respective municipalities.
Construction – Manages contractors, vendors, budget and schedule throughout the infrastructure construction process.
Leadership – Leads land development activities within region and collaborates with regional team, executive team, local jurisdictions and contractors to resolve miscellaneous matters related to residential subdivisions.



As a Regional Land Development Manager, you communicate effectively and concisely and build strong working relationships. You are a strong negotiator, and able to work with a diverse group of consultants, contractors, and vendors, utilizing your solid conflict resolution skills when needed. You are adept on planning and prioritizing your work, holding yourself accountable to create regional opportunities that align with  Hayden Homes’ land development strategies.



 
High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or Construction related field desired.


Knowledge and understanding of heavy civil construction contracting processes, methods, and cost analysis.
General knowledge of residential infrastructure and building construction.
Knowledge and understanding of land use entitlement and land division laws, processes and procedures.


Proficient in Microsoft Office programs including Outlook, Excel, Word, Project and PowerPoint.
Proficient in PDF editor (Adobe, BlueBeam or equivalent).
Construction and Project Management.Proficient in AutoCAD desired, but not required.


Ability to read and interpret civil engineering plans and specifications.
Ability to effectively communicate, both orally and in writing, to various audiences.
Able to make public presentations at City/County Council and Commission Hearings and meet with public officials in a professional manner.
Can build relationships and communicate effectively with individuals in various functional areas inside and outside of the organization.
Ability to motivate team members to produce quality work within tight timeframes while managing multiple priorities simultaneously.
Ability to develop and coach employees, challenging direct reports to excel in all aspects of performance.
Ability to make financially responsible decisions to accomplish goals and maintain high company standard.

Professional Engineering license preferred.


Minimum of 5 years’ experience in at least one of the following areas: land development, civil engineering, land surveying or land planning required.Previous real estate/development experience in Construction, and/or Engineering, strongly preferred.

Approximately 25% annually within local and regional areas.  Team member may be required to use their own vehicle when required to travel.

How You Will Be Rewarded

Hayden Homes’ compensation and benefits package consists of a competitive base salary along with quarterly bonus opportunities, generous health care coverage including medical, dental and vision benefits for team members and dependents, flexible spending accounts, life and disability insurance, 401(k) plan with company match, a team member home purchase discount, paid time off, volunteer time off, education reimbursement and career development opportunities. 



HAYDEN HOMES has been fulfilling the dream of home ownership for thirty years. As the largest residential home builder in the Pacific Northwest, we build high quality homes at an affordable price. Our Give As You Go ™ philosophy supports our team members in giving of our time, talent and resources to the communities where we live and work.

We are continually striving to enhance the experience of our team members, which is one of the reasons we’ve been named the #1 Best Company to Work For by Oregon Business Magazine and Seattle Business Magazine, and are in the top 10 Best Places to Work in Idaho.

At Hayden Homes, we embrace diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.  We employ, train, compensate and promote team members regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.

This position is not open to agencies or 3rd party recruiters.

title: Architectural Lighting Designer
compensation: Compensation comensurate with experience. We offer great benefits-Medical, Dental, Vision, flexible workschedule, 401(k) and profit sharing plans
description:
KGM Architectural Lighting- We are doing great projects around the world with remarkable clients, and have a great group of exceptional Designers. We continue to grow and are looking for talented passionate designers to join our team. Experience in Architecture, Interior Design or Lighting Design firms are required.

You will develop lighting designs and schematics for large-scale integrated architectural, landscape, & urban projects involving daylighting and electric lighting through analysis of architectural spaces.  Our Designers performs light-level and energy consumption calculations, simulations, and detailed analysis of electric lighting, sunlight and energy use.  

Intermediate experience in CADS and Revit for building Information in both 2-D and 3-D architectural software, 	Create plans illustrating the design of an aesthetically balanced environment and conducts research to compare different designs in addition to developing presentations and documentation of potential lighting design solutions, including sketches, renderings, detailed calculations, lighting layouts, controls and energy/budget analysis to present design options to client team.

If you have an outgoing personality, like working in a team and with clients you may be a great fit.  We offer dynamic work environment and career development opportunities.

title: Architectural CAD Drafting / Survey - No Experience Required - Travel
description:
We are a small Architectural firm in Canoga Park, CA. specializing in Architectural As-built drawings and Square Footage Calculations. A family-owned business with over 35 years in the industry. We are currently looking for ARCHITECTURAL DRAFTERS / SURVEYORS. This is a Full-Time Employment position that will be paid on a Salary basis - we are not looking for Contractors at this time. The position is somewhat of an "entry-level" position that requires about 3-6 months of training on our process and workflow. 

We are open to candidates with no previous CAD Experience as we prioritize other factors first. Primarily we are looking for someone with great Customer Service Skills, Promptness, Quick Learner and excellent ability to Communicate. Since we will do all the training in regards to the CAD skills required, we believe that our ideal candidate will possess these attributes.

This is a very specialized position that entails drafting in real-time on-site (using laser to cad technology) and then completing those drawings back in the office. We have created a specific software and process to do this work and will provide all the training and equipment necessary to learn. Once again no CAD skills are necessary for this position, but they would be a plus. 

We are based in Canoga Park and a majority of our business takes place in the Southern California area but our projects occur throughout the U.S. so there will be air travel. The travel is a large part of this position, as sometimes it is easier and faster to stay locally to a property vs. traveling to and from. The travel can sometimes be short notice or for extended periods - we do try and avoid this if at all possible. We work on a variety of different types of properties (Commercial, Retail, Residential, etc.) so it's always interesting and different from project to project. There is a comfortable mix of spending time working in the office and out in the field surveying.

All Applicants must have reliable transportation and be dependable. Since a good portion of our work is in the L.A. and surrounding areas it is preferred that all applicants currently live in the vicinity of the office and will be willing to commute to our location 5 days a week.

Skills required;

Customer Service Oriented
Full knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
Excellent Communication Skills
Self-Motivated
Able to work alone
Team player
Architectural Knowledge a plus (Construction, Design, etc.) 
AutoCAD and/or Revit experience a plus (CAD training provided)
Survey experience a plus (Survey training will be provided)
Reliable Transportation and a Valid Driver's License
Ability to Travel (air travel and local travel - possibly for extended periods/short notice)


Please respond to this ad with your resume, and an introduction while briefly explaining why you think you'd be a good fit for this position. You MUST include the words SURVEY/DRAFTING POSITION in the subject line of your email/application. 

Thank You.

title: Senior Project Environmental Geologist
compensation: Excellent salary and benefits commensurate with experience.
description:
Job Description: Ninyo & Moore has an immediate opening for a Senior Project Environmental Geologist in Irvine or Monterey Park, CA. The successful candidate will prepare and manage Phase I and Phase II Environmental Site Assessments, Initial Site Assessments (Caltrans), Hazardous Materials Assessments (CEQA/NEPA), Preliminary Endangerment Assessments (PEAs), Conceptual site models, and Risk Assessments. Responsibilities will include meeting and interacting with the clients and regulatory agencies, managing project budgets and schedules and performing some business development activities with select clients. The candidate will also coordinate and participate in field activities, including drilling supervision, logging of borings, test pits, trenches and cores; evaluating geologic and hydrogeologic conditions; and sampling soil, soil gas, and groundwater; and will prepare environmental proposals and reports.

Education: B.S./M.S. in Geology.

Required Skills: The successful candidate should be a licensed professional geologist with 10+ years of experience in environmental consulting. The ideal candidate will bring local experience and familiarity with the local geologic practice and a strong knowledge of local, state and federal regulations. The ideal candidate will be familiar with the hazardous materials aspect of the CEQA/NEPA process and will understand how mitigation measures are established. The candidate should be a team player, detail oriented, and have excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience with construction activities is also desired.

Status: Full time

title: Administrative Project Manager
description:
Title of Job: Administrative Project Manager
FLSA Status: Exempt

The expected number of hours required per week is 20. Hours may vary depending on business activity of the firm.

Employee rate offered is $45 /hr inclusive of health insurance allowance

Position Description:
The Administrative Project Manager (APM) provides essential support to the project managers, the owner, and administrative staff to ensure that internal business processes are managed according to project management best practices.

Major Areas of Responsibility:
The APM supports the business by coordinating timely and accurate monthly billings for lump sum contracts, hourly contracts, and mixed contracts in the field of Architecture, Structural Engineering and Civil Engineering.

This selected applicant will report to the principal and be responsible for assisting approximately eight Project Managers (PMs) with project setup, project tracking, project invoicing, and with change requests. The APM will assist the PMs to prepare and recommend project customer billing on a monthly basis. This includes reviewing project budgets and contract terms, monitoring changes to scope, and tracking and entering subcontracts.

The APM will become facile with the company time tracking, billing, and project tracking system (RADAR). The APM will perform tasks such as preparing invoices, generating change requests, answering customers’ questions about invoices, reversing and/or adjusting customer invoicing, correcting time entries that are improperly categorized, reviewing account receivables, adjusting billing rates, recording credit memos, entering project data, and reviewing project expense history.

Experience within the design and construction industry, and demonstrated knowledge of project life cycle, phases of work, contract types, billing systems and typical responsibilities of consultants, owners, contractors, and design professionals.
 

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Job Requirements
Education and Experience:

Primary:
Minimum 5 years relevant Project Management experience with a General Contractor, Architecture Firm or Engineering Firm. Experience in the design and/or construction field is required.
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and accounting calculations and computations.
Experience with service industry best practices for project accounting, including handling retainers, initial payments, credit memos, percentage billings and change requests.
Strong affinity for computer systems and software
Strong analytical skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent interpersonal skills

Secondary:
Experience with generating responses to Requests for Proposals in an architecture or engineering firm.
Experience working with AIA contracts.
Professional and client service oriented.
Quick learner, resourceful and self–starter with a strong work ethic
High sense of urgency and ownership of deliverables. 
Demonstrated ability to manage to deadlines.
Strong organization skills with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks
Strong attention to detail
Strong business and project acumen
Experience with Quickbooks, Procore, Archi-Office or other project management software. Experience with Microsoft Project or equivalent is a plus.

Physical Demands
These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions.

Work Environment
While performing the responsibilities of the job, these work environment characteristics are representative of the environment the job holder will encounter. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. The passage of employees through the work area is average and normal.

Conclusion
This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.
Benefits: 

Paid time off: 20 days, inclusive of 7 holidays, with increases over time per employee the policy; part time employees will receive prorated pay for Paid Time Off according to the number of working hours relative to full time working hours. 

Profit Sharing Plan: The employer will contribute to the profit sharing plan on behalf of the employee subject to the terms of the profit sharing plan agreement if the employee working hours per calendar year exceeds 1,000.

The selected applicant will be subject to a 90 calendar-day trial period. Benefits will become active if the employee is retained beyond the expiration of that time-period.

title: ELECTRICAL ENGINEER--EVERY FRIDAY OFF!!
description:
Aveox is an industry leader in designing and producing low-weight/high-powered brushless DC motor and controller solutions for a variety of aviation, aerospace, medical, and industrial customers; we have continually developed and applied innovative motion control technology to meet our customers ultra-critical, environmentally-challenging, high power-density, low-EMI, superior-reliability requirements. 

We are seeking an experienced Electrical Engineer to perform power electronics design and analysis on new and existing products. This individual will have broad electrical engineering experience with power electronics analysis experience preferably in the military/aerospace industry. Develops motion control systems, motor and controller design, power electronics, and servo design. In addition to the technical ability, we are looking for someone who can demonstrate sound, independent judgment and decision-making coupled with the ability to think “big picture” in relation to engineering. 

Responsibilities: 
•	Design electrical/electronic/embedded products, test fixtures, and systems for aerospace, military, industrial and medical applications. 
•	Perform engineering analyses, including design margin, thermal, reliability, FMECA and safety. 
•	Prepare ATP, QTP, DVT and ESS documents, and supervise/perform various testing including bring-up and design verification tests. Identify potential weak points, and develop solutions based on engineering judgment, and input from customer, suppliers and other systems partners
•	Prepare and present design summaries as a power system subject matter expert. 
•	Coordinate and support seamless transfer of new products for manufacturing operation.
•	Establish appropriate flow-down of system requirements to the electronic component level. Ability to understand system specifications, layouts and functions, and the interfaces to other platform systems. Assist in review and refinement of system or component specification(s).
•	Perform engineering analyses, including design margin, thermal, reliability, FMECA and safety. 
•	Prepare and present design summaries as a power system subject matter expert. 
•	Coordinate and support seamless transfer of new products for manufacturing operation
•	Process Engineering Change Order (ECO’s) to existing drawings.

Qualifications: 
•	BSEE with 5 years of analog/digital/power electronics design experience
•	Experience in Power Electronics related to motion control systems, servo systems, and analog design is necessary. Previous experience in aerospace/military fields highly desirable. 
•	Fluent in SPICE, Altium, and MathCAD or similar analysis tools
•	Power conversion/inversion knowledge with application dependent trade study skills
•	Candidate must be U.S. citizenship/permanent resident status
•	Must be a self-starter and a tenacious, proactive individual who can manage multiple tasks in a fast paced, team oriented environment with minimal supervision. 
•	Motor Driver knowledge including FOC techniques, and MOSFET/IGBT control is desirable
•	Working knowledge of DO-160, DO-178, DO-254 and MIL-STD-461 is desirable
•	Experience with C assembly language programming experience and Airborne/military system qualification and certification process experience is highly desirable. 

We offer the ideal candidate the opportunity to be part of a progressive organization along with a competitive compensation and benefits package. Interested parties please email resume.  Visit our website at www.aveox.com

title: Architect Job Captain
description:
Ultra-Unit Archtiectural Studio

WWW.ULTRA-UNIT.COM

EXPERIENCE & SKILLS including demonstrated working knowledge and understanding of:
